media:group.media:title: A Wrong Turn
media:group.media:description:
A friendly game of heads or tails leads to a (quite frankly, easily avoidable) misadventure for ol' Luigi.
Written and animated by Green
Mario rig by BradleyisGone Luigi rig by AndratVA Environments & props by Green
Made with Blender 2.91

media:group.media:title: Genesis
media:group.media:description:
[Flashing lights, yelling]
This is fiction. None of the events depicted in this video actually happened, and are merely for entertainment purposes.
[HUGE thanks to Godly, Jefftastic and Mozark for helping out in the making of the engine used in this vid] [Mario voice pitch correction patch by BWGLite]
A highlight of some private recordings, chronicling the development timeline of Super Mario 64 from April to July 1995. These were found at an abandoned Nintendo HQ situated in the Akihabara district of Japan. Curiously enough, according to the recordings, the staff occupying the building seems to have been nearly exclusively English-speaking. Nintendo's fun is eternal.
Voice Cast ---------- Mozark as Jim Greenio as Steve and Bill
TOP PATRONS (02-08-2021) --------------------------------------------- BWGLite soniccool234561
Twitter | https://twitter.com/greenio64 Patreon | https://www.patreon.com/greenio?fan_landing=true DeviantArt | https://www.deviantart.com/greenhat64

media:group.media:description:
Original version | https://youtu.be/SuUdcLpS5uk

media:group.media:title: Promo show
media:group.media:description:
This is fiction. None of the events depicted in this video actually happened, and are merely for entertainment purposes.
[SGI Mario model by the Render96 team] https://linktr.ee/Render96 [Original floor 2B idea by Blackjoystick and Razer Bloxy]
Cancelled pilot for a gaming news show titled "Nintendo Mania" (possibly linked to the Mexican-produced show of the same name). The show is comprised of animated segments where a 3D model of Mario announces the latest gaming news, before transitioning into long stretches of gameplay.
This first episode features a pre-E3 1996 build of Super Mario 64, offering footage of cut areas in Peach's castle, as well as a playable Luigi.
The pilot was cancelled after test audiences reacted negatively to the crude humor and bad animation. 2 other episodes were reportedly written.
Very little is known of its production, apart from a writing credit attributed to a "Jim". Mario's voice actor remains unknown, though it is likely that these were simply placeholder recordings.
Nintendo's fun is eternal.
Twitter | https://twitter.com/greenio64 DeviantArt | https://www.deviantart.com/greenhat64

media:group.media:title: Snow level playtest
media:group.media:description:
This is fiction. None of the events depicted in this video actually happened, and are merely for entertainment purposes.
Video shot by a former playtester at Nintendo, presumably for a friend to see. The level shown seems to be a scrapped third snowy level, seen here replacing Shifting Sand Land.
Nintendo's fun is eternal.
Twitter | https://twitter.com/greenio64 DeviantArt | https://www.deviantart.com/greenhat64

media:group.media:title: Prologue
media:group.media:description:
This is fiction. None of the events depicted in this video actually happened, and are merely for entertainment purposes.
[Kiosk by @RM05 https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZcUVLRsiNPVWI_eLAvuZyg]
Unauthorized amateur footage of two previously unseen areas of the Spaceworld 1995 build of Super Mario 64, captured on the showfloor of the event. Curiously, the presence of English in-game text suggests that it may have been a misplaced development cartridge intended for showcase in the west.
Nintendo's fun is eternal.
Twitter | https://twitter.com/greenio64 DeviantArt | https://www.deviantart.com/greenhat64
